content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This is a good clash that is original enough to be fun, but can easily be solved  in languages with built-in transpose functionality. In other languages, it becomes a bit more challenging but still solvable in 5 minutes.
The reference solution would fail in a corner case when a first row (a second line of input) is empty. The tests don't cover it but according to the description it should output "Invalid".

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Original clash

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice one

Goal
* Please rewrite all except the last paragraph as follows:

Given [[n]] the number of lines, and also [[list_strings]] of [[n]] lines of elements separated by a space as input. Your task is to print the transposed matrix, with elements in the same line separated by a space.
All lines must contain the same number of elements. If not, print {{Invalid}}.
If [[n]] is 0, print {{None}}.

Input
* Please change "Following lines" to "Next [[n]] lines".

Output
* Please add "or {{Invalid}} or {{None}}.

Constraints
* Please change "N" to "n" for consistency.

* Please change the upper bound to 100 because [[n]] does not exceed 100 in all the cases.

Cases
* Except for the n=0 case, please change each pair of test and validator so that they are similar but not the same.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement, e.g. "write answer".

Thanks.

It's poor form on CodinGame to have empty lines as input usually, because it can lead to unexpected bugs with otherwise workable code. So it's not a critical issue that this code would fail on that hypothetical corner case.

Note: the error would be "IndexError: list index out of range" and the code would not output anything, so it's not that the code would be incorrect either, it just fails to output.

Well spotted though.
Please add back the explanation on how transposition is done (i.e. your original last paragraph). Thanks.
